title: How to Cook Macaroni Pancakes

steps.headline: Boil the dry macaroni elbows until al dente and tender.
Drain the pasta in a colander and shake around to dry.
Combine the flour and salt in a large bowl with a wooden spoon.
Whisk and beat the egg and milk in a separate bowl.
Fold in the flour mixture and whisk until there are no lumps.
Pour in the mustard and only a cup of the cheese.
Heat up a tablespoon of oil or butter on a large skillet on medium heat.
Scoop the pancake batter on the skillet using a ladle.
steps.description: Swirl around to help the pancake spread.

steps.headline: Sprinkle a few pieces of cooked pasta and cheese on the pancake before flipping.
Flip the pancake carefully using a spatula.
steps.description: Allow the other side to cook until crispy and golden brown.

steps.headline: Repeat until there is no more pancake batter.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the pancakes on a serving plate with the crispy sides up. Consider topping with extra cheese, BBQ sauce, or other desired toppings. Enjoy!

text: Boil the dry macaroni elbows until al dente and tender.  Drain the pasta in a colander and shake around to dry.  Combine the flour and salt in a large bowl with a wooden spoon.  Whisk and beat the egg and milk in a separate bowl.  Fold in the flour mixture and whisk until there are no lumps.  Pour in the mustard and only a cup of the cheese. Stir the mixture together. Heat up a tablespoon of oil or butter on a large skillet on medium heat.  Scoop the pancake batter on the skillet using a ladle. Swirl around to help the pancake spread. Sprinkle a few pieces of cooked pasta and cheese on the pancake before flipping.  Flip the pancake carefully using a spatula. Allow the other side to cook until crispy and golden brown. Repeat until there is no more pancake batter.  Serve. Place the pancakes on a serving plate with the crispy sides up. Consider topping with extra cheese, BBQ sauce, or other desired toppings. Enjoy!
